metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost - Description[]

Black Spire Outpost was located on the planet Batuu in the Outer Rim Territories and was considered one of the last stops before Wild Space and the Unknown Regions. Its name was derived from the petrified remains of ancient trees turned into gray and brown stone spires that were large enough to tower over the outpost, with the eponymous Black Spire standing out due to its black hue and smooth texture reminiscent of volcanic glass.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost

Black Spire Outpost


General information

Constructed
At least four millennia before the Cold War


Location
Batuu


Terrain
Urban


Points of interest
Black SpireBlack Spire Outpost MarketBlack Spire RuinsDarshi HousesLand PortMerchant RowSavi's PathService YardSpaceport



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Oga GarraFirst OrderResistance


[Source]

Black Spire Outpost (BSO), commonly known as Black Spire, was an outpost on the planet Batuu on the edge of the Outer Rim Territories. It was one of the last stops before Wild Space and the Unknown Regions. The outpost was named for the giant petrified trees that towered over it, and one in particular that was colored black, the Black Spire.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Station

Black Spire Station


General information

Locations
Land Port, Black Spire Outpost, Batuu



Operational information

Staff
Salju


Goods
Droid parts


[Source]

Black Spire Station was a business location in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu that sold various droid parts. People searching for parts at the station could look to Salju for assistance. Several droids, including an R2 unit, an R3 unit, an R4 unit, a G2 droid, and two box droids, were also found near the location alongside at least one speeder bike and two landspeeders. Fuel and repairs for vehicles were available at this location and it was almost always open.
metadata.title: Black Spire Station

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost - Early history[]

Before the invention of hyperspace travel, Batuu was a busy stop for travelers to trade or refuel as they passsed through the Outer Rim or journeyed into Wild Space. However, with the rise of the hyperdrive and new hyperspace routes that bypassed the planet, it instead became home to those who did not want to be found. The outpost evolved into a thriving spaceport for smugglers, rogue traders, and adventurers traveling between the galactic frontier and uncharted space. Eventually, Chandrila Star Line began operating luxury cruises in the region for travelers who sought adventure and comfort on their expeditions.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost - Black Spire[]

The Black Spire, from which the outpost derived its name, was located near the center of the outpost.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outfitters

Black Spire Outfitters


General information

Locations
Black Spire Outpost Market, Black Spire Outpost, Batuu



Operational information

Owners
Arta Kleidun


Staff
GX-8


Goods
Clothing


[Source]

Black Spire Outfitters, also known as Arta's shop, was a clothing store that could be found among the many shops in the market of Black Spire Outpost on Batuu. It was owned by Arta Kleidun and employed the sewing droid GX-8.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outfitters

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost Obelisk

Black Spire Outpost Obelisk


General information

Location
Black Spire Outpost


[Source]

The Black Spire Outpost Obelisk was a stone obelisk located in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was carved by local artisans with patterns matching those found on the outpost's original buildings. By the time of the war between the First Order and the Resistance, it had become tradition amongst visitors and locals of the outpost to touch the obelisk and say "Til the Spire" for good luck and in hopes of safely returning to the outpost in future.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost Obelisk

metadata.content:
# Black Spire

Black Spire


General information

Type
Petrified tree


Location
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu


[Source]


The Black Spire was a petrified tree found in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was considered the heart of the outpost and was located next to Dok-Ondar's Den of Antiquities and Savi's Workshop. It was also the namesake of the outpost and an ancient gathering place for locals to tell stories. The spire was seen as a symbol of hope and rebirth, as it had a live tree growing from its center.
metadata.title: Black Spire

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Day

Black Spire Day

Observation

Observed by
Batuuan


Significance
Commemorate the founding of Black Spire Outpost


Place
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu


[Source]

Black Spire Day was a holiday celebrated at Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was to commemorate the founding of the outpost. Locals would decorate the outpost with colorful ribbons and tarps while celebrating with parades and feasts. It would occasionally end with a fireworks display.
metadata.title: Black Spire Day

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost transport

Black Spire Outpost transport


Production information

Type
Transport



Technical specifications

Engine unit(s)
2



Usage

Affiliation
Black Spire Outpost


[Source]


A transport shuttle operating out of Black Spire Outpost on Batuu carried passengers from the surface to ships in space and back, including the MPO-1400 Purgill-class star cruiser Halcyon. The vessel was piloted by RX-Series pilot droid J6-F8. The transports were provided by Oga Garra, and could be boarded at the cruise ship's Transport Dock on Deck 6.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost transport

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Ruins

Black Spire Ruins


General information

Location
Batuu



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Resistance


[Source]


The Black Spire Ruins, called the old post by locals, or simply referred to as the ancient ruins, were located at the edge of Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. Belonging to an ancient settlement and formerly the original outpost, the ruins were at one time the site of a temporary Resistance encampment, which the Resistance picked largely because it had been ideal for their needs. The encampment included a DF.12 Com Turret at an entrance that led directly into the ruins and into caves which included ancient artifacts and worship sites. The Resistance built their control center inside, in some cases cutting through rock to widen the caves.

Several Resistance recruits were once scrambled there alongside BB-8 to their fighters. Prior to a space battle with the First Order, a group of recruits departed from the ruins on a mission in a transport before the vessel's capture and eventual escape from a Star Destroyer.
metadata.title: Black Spire Ruins

metadata.content:

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost Market

Black Spire Outpost Market


General information

Location
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu


Terrain
Urban


Points of interest
Black Spire Outpost ObeliskBlack Spire OutfittersCreature StallJewels of BithKat Saka's KettleRonto RoastersToydarian ToymakerThe Wooden Wookiee


[Source]


The Black Spire Outpost Market was located in Black Spire Outpost on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. Merchants located within the Market included Black Spire Outfitters, Creature Stall, Jewels of Bith, Toydarian Toymaker, and The Wooden Wookiee. Kat Saka's Kettle and Ronto Roasters were eateries.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost Market

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Outpost Market - Description[]

The Black Spire Outpost Market was an avenue on the Outer Rim planet of Batuu, located within the boundaries of Black Spire Outpost. The street was partially covered with tarps, latticework, and wires strung overhead. Local Batuuans lived in the upper levels, while the lower levels housed local shops, including Black Spire Outfitters, Jewels of Bith, Toydarian Toymaker, and The Wooden Wookiee. Visitors to the area could also purchase a variety of pets or other small animals from the Creature Stall. The quick-service restaurant Ronto Roasters operated next door to the snackfood stand Kat Saka's Kettle.

Water dispensers throughout the Market provided refreshment to visitors, who were often surprised to learn that the plumbing housed Tiny the dianoga. The Black Spire Outpost Obelisk served as a local landmark at the entrance to the Market.
metadata.title: Black Spire Outpost Market

metadata.content:
# Batuu sea bear

Batuu sea bear


Biological classification

Classification
Bear


[Source]

Batuu sea bears were bears that shared their name with the planet Batuu. In 382 BBY, a crystalized skull of an ancient Batuu sea bear was one of many artifacts in the artifact chamber of the Batuu Jedi temple, with a compass tucked behind it.
metadata.title: Batuu sea bear

metadata.content:
# Batuu Wilds

Batuu Wilds


General information

Location
Batuu


Points of interest
Dead Root RefugeHissiq SpringsThree Suns Overlook


[Source]


The Batuu Wilds was an undeveloped region of the planet Batuu. It was composed of giant spires and rugged, rocky canyons. Some points of interest included the Three Suns Overlook, the Dead Root Refuge and the Hissiq Springs.
metadata.title: Batuu Wilds

metadata.content:
# Batuu - Fauna[]

Batuu was host to a variety of different creatures, including the Batlizard, Batuuan braga bear, dugar dugar, lahiroo, pipa bird, Snarlok, nightsnake, terra tree toad, Batuuan Rat, and Spiran Firefly. Catfish also lived in the sinkholes.

In 34 ABY, creatures such as demlins, acid-spitters and Kowakian monkey-lizards could be found in regions of the Batuu Wilds such as around the Three Suns Overlook, Dead Root Refuge and Hissiq Springs. At that time, porgs could also be seen at Seezelslak's cantina.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuu - Other settlements[]

Peka and Surabat were also Batuaan communities. Galma was known for its illegal podracing.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuuan braga bear - Behavior[]

The bears chased after their prey and were known to chase the inhabitants of Batuu, where they were the apex predator.
metadata.title: Batuuan braga bear

metadata.content:
# Batuuan braga bear - History[]

In 34 ABY, when the Chadra-Fan Resistance member Kriki noticed that the smuggler Zade Kalliday was running towards them, she speculated that Kalliday had either encountered a braga bear or was in trouble; in reality, it was the latter. During or after that year, the safari droid SF-R3 visited Batuu in order to learn about the porgs and attempt to teach them tricks. While hiking up a mountain to get to them, his cam droid, CAM, ran into one of the bears in a cave, but the droid was able to quickly escape.

Later, while trying to train a trio of porgs to play dead, a Batuuan braga bear approached, causing the porgs to fly away in fright and leaving the droids by themselves. They too ran away, with SF-R3 begging the bear to not eat him. When recounting his adventures on Batuu for a holorecording for the Galactic Society of Creature Enthusiasts, the droid noted that while he intended to be the teacher on the planet, he ended up learning a lesson: to run when a braga bear's growl was heard. As he recorded the segment, a bear again chased after him, causing him to flee again.
metadata.title: Batuuan braga bear

metadata.content:
# Batuu - Description[]

Batuu was a temperate planet that was located on the edge of the Outer Rim Territories, within the Trilon sector's Batuu system. The planet orbited three suns—Ubaat I, Ubaat II, and Ubaat III. The world was the location of Black Spire Outpost, a haven for those looking to avoid attracting too much attention to themselves. Batuu's market stalls were known to have all sorts of items from all parts of the galaxy.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuu - Black Spire Outpost[]

The planet's largest population center, Black Spire Outpost, was neighbored by rural settlements. In 34 ABY, the outpost had a spaceport for starship arrivals. Locals arrived by foot or by landspeeder, with some utilizing Savi's Path.

Black Spire Outpost Market housed several local merchants, including Black Spire Outfitters, Creature Stall, Jewels of Bith, Toydarian Toymaker, and The Wooden Wookiee. Eateries such as Ronto Roasters and Kat Saka's Kettle were also found in the market.

Outside of the market, Docking Bay 7 at the end of Merchant Row was the location of Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo, containing many converted cargo pods used by local vendors who sold wares such as meat and fresh crops. Another pod had a full kitchen within that was used by weekly guest chefs who docked their food freighters on the roof above the hangar. Local Batuuans worked at the pod where customers placed orders. Merchant Row continued to Dok-Ondar's Den of Antiquities, Oga's Cantina, the Milk Stand, and First Order Cargo within Docking Bay 9.

The industrial Land Port contained Black Spire Station, Droid Depot, and Savi's Workshop.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuuan Spira

Batuuan Spira was the ancient currency of Black Spire Outpost. Around 34 ABY, the Spira took the form of a hexagonal chip of either dull yellow or silvery metal. Its obverse face bore the word "Spira" and the letters "BSO" for Black Spire Outpost in Aurebesh above three columns and a half-circle with a smaller complete circle resting on its edge.
metadata.title: Batuuan Spira

[Source]

Batuu was a remote terrestrial planet on the edge of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories, in the Batuu system of the Trilon sector. Batuu's surface was covered in jungles, oceans, and the petrified remains of ancient trees, referred to by the local Batuuans as "spires," which towered over the planet's landscapes. Millennia before the rise of the Galactic Empire and prior to the invention of hyperspace travel, Batuu was a popular stopping point for those traveling to Wild Space and the Unknown Regions. However, the opening of hyperspace routes caused the planet to be bypassed, resulting in the deterioration of the planet's reputation into that of a forgotten backwater world.

The largest settlement on the planet was the ancient trading post Black Spire Outpost. By the time of the war between the Resistance and the First Order, the outpost had devolved into a seedy smuggler's haven run by the intimidating Blutopian Oga Garra. The world was also home to farming communities, such as Peka and Surabat, and the town of Galma, known for its mechanics.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuu - Flora[]

Batuu was once host to massive trees, though the giants were destroyed during a cataclysm that devastated the planet's surface. The remains of the trees became petrified gray and brown stone that towered over their surroundings and were referred to by local Batuuans as "spires." Those spires became landmarks for settlers. A smaller species of dark green conifers called Batuu trees grew in stony soil or clung to rocky surfaces across the planet.

Golden Lichen was a native form of lichen that grew on many of the planet's towering spires and buildings. Nicknamed "gold dust," it was harvested for use as a cooking spice and a clothing dye.
metadata.title: Batuu

metadata.content:
# Batuuan Harvest Festival

Batuuan Harvest Festival

Observation

Observed by
Batuuan


Observances
Autumn harvest


Place
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu


[Source]


The Batuuan Harvest Festival was a holiday celebrated at Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was held in the autumn to celebrate the harvest season, especially Golden Lichen. During the celebration, Oga Garra allowed the lichen to be used in special dishes and drinks. The locals decorated the outpost with golden colored banners and often accentuated their clothing similarly.
metadata.title: Batuuan Harvest Festival

metadata.content:
# Batuuan braga bear

Batuuan braga bear


Biological classification

Designation
Non-sentient


Classification
Bear



Physical characteristics

Hair color
Brown



Sociocultural characteristics

Homeworld
Batuu


Habitat
Mountainous caves


[Source]

Batuuan braga bears were a species of bear that lived on the planet Batuu. They were brown and chased after their prey. When the droid SF-R3 visited Batuu, he learned that the growl of a braga bear was a sign to run away.
metadata.title: Batuuan braga bear

metadata.content:
# Batuuan braga bear - Biology and appearance[]

Batuuan braga bears were a type of bear native to the planet Batuu. The bears had brown fur, a tail, pointed teeth, and black claws, and they lived in caves in the mountains. Porgs, an avian species that had been brought to Batuu, knew to run when they heard a braga bear's growl.
metadata.title: Batuuan braga bear

metadata.content:
# Batuu system

Batuu system


Astrographical information

Region
Outer Rim TerritoriesGalactic Frontier


Sector
Trilon sector


Grid square
G-15


XYZ coordinates
-401.72, -561.84, 004.32


Suns
3:Ubaat IUbaat IIUbaat III


Orbiting bodies
Batuu


[Source]


The Batuu system was a star system with three stars that was located in the Trilon sector of the Outer Rim Territories on the edge of the Unknown Regions at galactic coordinates -401.72, -561.84, 004.32. It contained the planet Batuu and its two moons.
metadata.title: Batuu system

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Day

Black Spire Day

Observation

Observed by
Batuuan


Significance
Commemorate the founding of Black Spire Outpost


Place
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu


[Source]

Black Spire Day was a holiday celebrated at Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. It was to commemorate the founding of the outpost. Locals would decorate the outpost with colorful ribbons and tarps while celebrating with parades and feasts. It would occasionally end with a fireworks display.
metadata.title: Black Spire Day

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Ruins

Black Spire Ruins


General information

Location
Batuu



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Resistance


[Source]


The Black Spire Ruins, called the old post by locals, or simply referred to as the ancient ruins, were located at the edge of Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu. Belonging to an ancient settlement and formerly the original outpost, the ruins were at one time the site of a temporary Resistance encampment, which the Resistance picked largely because it had been ideal for their needs. The encampment included a DF.12 Com Turret at an entrance that led directly into the ruins and into caves which included ancient artifacts and worship sites. The Resistance built their control center inside, in some cases cutting through rock to widen the caves.

Several Resistance recruits were once scrambled there alongside BB-8 to their fighters. Prior to a space battle with the First Order, a group of recruits departed from the ruins on a mission in a transport before the vessel's capture and eventual escape from a Star Destroyer.
metadata.title: Black Spire Ruins
